TopicTitle: Breaking News: Reentry Effects are REAL! Space Shuttle Intrepid Lost on Reentry! (Video)

Articles.Content:
Reentry effects are real, and can strike you the wrong way the moment you don't respect them:

Javascript is disabled. View full album

This was totally unplanned and unexpected. I have a sense now what mission control managers felt like during a certain shuttle accident...

Edited April 28, 2015 by inigma

Oh, wow. Freaky...

I lost Val already in my career.... Made some monuments and memorials.

But a space shuttle! I could never build one, but if I did, I would make sure this exact thing wouldn't be possible.
Did you come flying in nose first or was it uncontrollable?

Did you come flying in nose first or was it uncontrollable?

It was controllable until about 30km, then I'm not sure what happened. I was in IVA when the explosions started.

- - - Updated - - -

I figured it out. I was carrying a 42 ton fuel depot in the bay that I uh... forgot to eject or burn prior to the abort. The shuttle was never designed to land with a full tank.

This is horrifying, inigma.

1.0 ruined many ships, possibilities and is unbearable. I'm backing up 0.90, whether compatible or not.

Poor Kerbals, though!

Edited April 28, 2015 by Columbia
Well I worked a bit on STS-5 concepts. The new wings are a no go.
